   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_jump_no_copt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0,suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 undefined_label/1,ambiguous_catch_try_state/1,
   25:          unsafe_move_elimination/1,build_tuple/1,
   26:          coverage/1,call_sharing/1,undecided_allocation/1]).
   27: 
   28: suite() ->
   29:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   30: 
   31: all() ->
   32:     [{group,p}].
   33: 
   34: groups() ->
   35:     [{p,[parallel],
   36:       [undefined_label,
   37:        ambiguous_catch_try_state,
   38:        unsafe_move_elimination,
   39:        build_tuple,
   40:        coverage,
   41:        call_sharing,
   42:        undecided_allocation
   43:       ]}].
   44: 
   45: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   46:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   50:     ok.
   51: 
   52: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: undefined_label(_Config) ->
   59:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch flights(0, [], [])),
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: %% Would lose a label when compiled with no_copt.
   63: 
   64: flights(0, [], []) when [], 0; 0.0, [], false ->
   65:     clark;
   66: flights(_, Reproduction, introduction) when false, Reproduction ->
   67:     responsible.
   68: 
   69: %% [ERL-209] beam_jump would share 'catch' blocks, causing an
   70: %% ambiguous_catch_try_state error in beam_validator.
   71: 
   72: ambiguous_catch_try_state(Config) ->
   73:     {{'EXIT',{{case_clause,song},_}},{'EXIT',{{case_clause,song},_}}} =
   74: 	checks(42),
   75: 
   76:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,42},_}} = (catch unsafe_sharing()),
   77: 
   78:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,b},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(<<>>)),
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,b},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(Config)),
   80: 
   81:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_2()),
   82:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} = (catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_3()),
   83: 
   84:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = catch ambiguous_catch_try_state_4(),
   85: 
   86:     ok.
   87: 
   88: river() -> song.
   89: 
   90: checks(Wanted) ->
   91:     %% Must be one line to cause the unsafe optimization.
   92:     {catch case river() of sheet -> begin +Wanted, if "da" -> Wanted end end end, catch case river() of sheet -> begin + Wanted, if "da" -> Wanted end end end}.
   93: 
   94: %% Must be one line to cause the unsafe optimization. Would cause beam_validator to reject the function.
   95: unsafe_sharing() -> try try id(42) catch parent:215 -> []; education:17 -> try 12 catch _:_ -> a end /= if false -> fy end end of [] -> if false -> a end catch _:_ -> name end.
   96: 
   97: unsafe_move_elimination(_Config) ->
   98:     {{left,right,false},false} = unsafe_move_elimination_1(left, right, false),
   99:     {{false,right,false},false} = unsafe_move_elimination_1(false, right, true),
  100:     {{true,right,right},right} = unsafe_move_elimination_1(true, right, true),
  101:     [ok = unsafe_move_elimination_2(I) || I <- lists:seq(0,16)],
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: unsafe_move_elimination_1(Left, Right, Simple0) ->
  105:     id(1),
  106: 
  107:     %% The move at label 29 would be removed by beam_jump, which is unsafe because
  108:     %% the two select_val instructions have different source registers.
  109:     %%
  110:     %%   {select_val,{y,0},{f,25},{list,[{atom,true},{f,27},{atom,false},{f,29}]}}.
  111:     %%               ^^^^^                                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  112:     %% {label,27}.
  113:     %%   {kill,{y,0}}.
  114:     %%   {move,{y,2},{x,0}}.
  115:     %%   {line,...}.
  116:     %%   {call,1,{f,31}}.
  117:     %%   {select_val,{x,0},{f,33},{list,[{atom,true},{f,35},{atom,false},{f,29}]}}.
  118:     %%               ^^^^^                                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  119:     %% {label,29}.
  120:     %%   {move,{atom,false},{y,0}}.  <=== REMOVED (unsafely).
  121:     %%   {jump,{f,37}}.
  122: 
  123:     Simple = case case Simple0 of
  124:                       false -> false;
  125:                       true -> id(Left)
  126:                   end
  127:              of
  128:                  false ->
  129:                      false;
  130:                  true ->
  131:                      id(Right)
  132:              end,
  133:     {id({Left,Right,Simple}),Simple}.
  134: 
  135: unsafe_move_elimination_2(Int) ->
  136:     %% The type optimization pass would recognize that TagInt can only be
  137:     %% [0 .. 7], so the first 'case' would select_val over [0 .. 6] and swap
  138:     %% out the fail label with the block for 7.
  139:     %%
  140:     %% A later optimization would merge this block with 'expects_h' in the
  141:     %% second case, as the latter is only reachable from the former.
  142:     %%
  143:     %% ... but this broke down when the move elimination optimization didn't
  144:     %% take the fail label of the first select_val into account. This caused it
  145:     %% to believe that the only way to reach 'expects_h' was through the second
  146:     %% case when 'Tag' =:= 'h', which made it remove the move instruction
  147:     %% added in the first case, passing garbage to expects_h/2.
  148:     TagInt = Int band 2#111,
  149:     Tag = case TagInt of
  150:               0 -> a;
  151:               1 -> b;
  152:               2 -> c;
  153:               3 -> d;
  154:               4 -> e;
  155:               5 -> f;
  156:               6 -> g;
  157:               7 -> h
  158:           end,
  159:     case Tag of
  160:         g -> expects_g(TagInt, Tag);
  161:         h -> expects_h(TagInt, Tag);
  162:         _ -> Tag = id(Tag), ok
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: expects_g(6, Atom) ->
  166:     Atom = id(g),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: expects_h(7, Atom) ->
  170:     Atom = id(h),
  171:     ok.
  172: 
  173: %% When compiled with +no_copt, beam_validator would complain about
  174: %% ambiguous try/catch state.
  175: ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(<<42:false>>) ->
  176:     %% The beam_ssa_bsm pass will duplicate the entire second clause.
  177:     %% beam_jump will share the blocks with the build_stacktrace
  178:     %% instructions.
  179:     [];
  180: ambiguous_catch_try_state_1(V0) ->
  181:     try
  182:         try
  183:             receive after bad -> timeout end
  184:         catch
  185:             _:V0 ->
  186:                 error
  187:         after
  188:             ok
  189:         end
  190:     of
  191:         true ->
  192:             ok
  193:     catch
  194:         month:power:V2 ->
  195:             %% A build_stacktrace instruction would be shared, causing
  196:             %% an ambiguous try/catch state.
  197:             V2
  198:     after
  199:         a = b
  200:     end.
  201: 
  202: ambiguous_catch_try_state_2() ->
  203:     case
  204:         try
  205:             case false = 0 of
  206:                    false ->
  207:                        hand
  208:                end
  209:         catch
  210:             idea:[]:V1 ->
  211:                 V1;
  212:             country:42 ->
  213:                 %% if_end would be shared in an unsafe way.
  214:                 if 0 -> way end after [] end of [] -> if $X -> "D" end
  215:     end.
  216: 
  217: ambiguous_catch_try_state_3() ->
  218:     case
  219:         try
  220:             case false = 0 of
  221:                    false ->
  222:                        hand
  223:                end
  224:         catch
  225:             idea:[]:V1 ->
  226:                 V1;
  227:             country:42 ->
  228:                 %% case_end would be shared in an unsafe way.
  229:                 case x of y -> way end after [] end of [] -> case x of $X -> "D" end
  230:     end.
  231: 
  232: 
  233: ambiguous_catch_try_state_4() ->
  234:     0.0 = try binary_to_float(garbage_collect() orelse ((1.0 = tuple_to_list(ok)) -- ok))
  235:           after
  236:               ok
  237:           end.
  238: 
  239: -record(message2, {id, p1}).
  240: -record(message3, {id, p1, p2}).
  241: 
  242: build_tuple(_Config) ->
  243:     Message2 = #message2{},
  244:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,Message2},_}} = (catch do_build_tuple(#message2{})),
  245:     ok.
  246: 
  247: do_build_tuple(Message) ->
  248:     if is_record(Message, message2) ->
  249: 	    Res = {res, rand:uniform(100)},
  250: 	    {Message#message3.id, Res}
  251:     end.
  252: 
  253: coverage(_Config) ->
  254:     ok = coverage_1(ok),
  255:     {error,badarg} = coverage_1({error,badarg}),
  256: 
  257:     gt = coverage_2(100, 42),
  258:     le = coverage_2(100, 999),
  259:     le = coverage_2([], []),
  260:     gt = coverage_2([], xxx),
  261: 
  262:     error = coverage_3(#{key => <<"child">>}),
  263:     error = coverage_3(#{}),
  264: 
  265:     ok = coverage_4(whatever),
  266:     -0.5 = coverage_4(any),
  267: 
  268:     ok.
  269: 
  270: coverage_1(Var) ->
  271:     case id(Var) of
  272: 	ok -> ok;
  273: 	Error -> Error
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: %% Cover beam_jump:invert_test(is_ne_exact).
  277: coverage_2(Pre1, Pre2) ->
  278:     case
  279:         case Pre1 == [] of
  280:             false ->
  281:                 false;
  282:             true ->
  283:                 Pre2 /= []
  284:         end
  285:     of
  286:         true ->
  287:             gt;
  288:         false ->
  289:             case Pre1 > Pre2 of
  290:                 true ->
  291:                     gt;
  292:                 false ->
  293:                     le
  294:             end
  295:     end.
  296: 
  297: coverage_3(#{key := <<child>>}) when false ->
  298:     ok;
  299: coverage_3(#{}) ->
  300:     error.
  301: 
  302: %% Cover beam_jump:value_to_literal/1.
  303: coverage_4(whatever) ->
  304:     maybe
  305:         coverage_4(ok),
  306:         ok
  307:     end;
  308: coverage_4(_) ->
  309:     (bnot 0) / 2.
  310: 
  311: %% ERIERL-478: The validator failed to validate argument types when calls were
  312: %% shared and the types at the common block turned out wider than the join of
  313: %% each individual call site.
  314: call_sharing(_Config) ->
  315:     A_2 = {a, 1},
  316:     A_3 = {a, 1, 2},
  317: 
  318:     A_2 = cs_1(id(A_2)),
  319:     A_3 = cs_1(id(A_3)),
  320: 
  321:     B_2 = {b, 1},
  322:     B_3 = {b, 1, 2},
  323:     B_2 = cs_1(id(B_2)),
  324:     B_3 = cs_1(id(B_3)),
  325: 
  326:     C_2 = {c, 1},
  327:     C_3 = {c, 1, 2},
  328:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch (cs_1(id(C_2)))),
  329:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch (cs_1(id(C_3)))),
  330: 
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: cs_1(Key) ->
  334:     A = case Key of
  335:             %% Must be a single line to trigger the bug.
  336:             {Tag, _, _} when Tag == a; Tag == b -> cs_2(Key); {Tag, _} when Tag == a; Tag == b -> cs_2(Key)
  337:         end,
  338:     id(A).
  339: 
  340: cs_2(I) -> I.
  341: 
  342: undecided_allocation(_Config) ->
  343:     ok = catch undecided_allocation_1(<<10:(3*7)>>),
  344:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,<<0>>},_}} = catch undecided_allocation_1(8),
  345: 
  346:     {bar,1} = undecided_allocation_2(id(<<"bar">>)),
  347:     {foo,2} = undecided_allocation_2(id(<<"foo">>)),
  348:     {'EXIT',_} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id(<<"foobar">>)),
  349:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,error},_}} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id("foo,bar")),
  350:     {'EXIT',_} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id(foobar)),
  351:     {'EXIT',_} = catch undecided_allocation_2(id(make_ref())),
  352: 
  353:     ok = undecided_allocation_3(id(<<0>>), gurka),
  354:     {'EXIT', {badarith, _}} = catch undecided_allocation_3(id(<<>>), gurka),
  355: 
  356:     ok.
  357: 
  358: -record(rec, {}).
  359: undecided_allocation_1(<<10:3/integer-unit:7>>) ->
  360:     ok;
  361: undecided_allocation_1(V) ->
  362:     %% The record update operation would be duplicated by the beam_ssa_bssm
  363:     %% pass, and beam_jump would incorrectly share the resulting calls to
  364:     %% error/1, causing beam_validator to issue the following diagnostic
  365:     %% when this module was compiled with the no_type_opt option:
  366:     %%
  367:     %%  Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
  368:     %%  Instruction: {call_ext,1,{extfunc,erlang,error,1}}
  369:     %%  Error:       {allocated,undecided}:
  370: 
  371:     <<
  372:       <<0>> || <<0:V>> <= <<0>>
  373:     >>#rec{},
  374:     if whatever -> [] end.
  375: 
  376: undecided_allocation_2(Order) ->
  377:     {_, _} =
  378:         case Order of
  379:             <<"bar">> ->
  380:                 {bar, 1};
  381:             <<"foo">> ->
  382:                 {foo, 2};
  383:             S ->
  384:                 case string:split("foo", "o") of
  385:                     [] ->
  386:                         ok;
  387:                     _ ->
  388:                         %% The beam_ssa_bsm pass will duplicate this code,
  389:                         %% and beam_jump would undo the duplication by sharing
  390:                         %% the code that calls lists:flatten/1. The problem was
  391:                         %% that the stack frames had different sizes for the
  392:                         %% two calls to lists:flatten/1. The diagnostic would be:
  393:                         %%
  394:                         %%  Internal consistency check failed - please report this bug.
  395:                         %%  Instruction: {call_ext,1,{extfunc,lists,flatten,1}}
  396:                         %%  Error:       {allocated,undecided}:
  397: 
  398:                         lists:flatten(
  399:                             case S of
  400:                                 Y when is_binary(Y) -> Y;
  401:                                 Y -> string:split(Y, ",")
  402:                             end
  403:                         )
  404:                 end,
  405:                 error
  406:         end.
  407: 
  408: %% GH-6571: bs_init_writable can only be shared when the stack frame size is
  409: %% known.
  410: undecided_allocation_3(<<_>>, _) ->
  411:     ok;
  412: undecided_allocation_3(X, _) ->
  413:     case 0 + get_keys() of
  414:         X ->
  415:             ok;
  416:         _ ->
  417:             (node() orelse garbage_collect()) =:=
  418:                 case <<0 || false>> of
  419:                     #{} ->
  420:                         ok
  421:                 end
  422:     end.
  423: 
  424: id(I) ->
  425:     I.
